meanings.definition: Speak in a low voice in a way that is not clear
meanings.sent1: Please don't mumble during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: She tends to mumble when she's nervous.
meanings.sent3: The shy student would always mumble his answers in class.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to mumble into the darkness of the room.
meanings.sent5: The old man would mumble stories by the fireplace.

meanings.sent1: The mumble of distant thunder could be heard.
meanings.sent2: I could hear a mumble of voices in the next room.
meanings.sent3: The mumble of the engine put me to sleep on the long drive.
meanings.sent4: The mumble of the crowd faded as the music started.
meanings.sent5: The soft mumble of the stream was soothing to listen to.
